alert.note: Alert for Curry County; Eastern San Miguel County; Quay County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 6:43PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL... CENTRAL QUAY AND NORTHEASTERN CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM MDT... At 643 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wheatland, or 21 miles southeast of Tucumcari, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Tucumcari, San Jon, Grady, Broadview, Wheatland and Bellview. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 331 and 354. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 98 and 105. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.

area.areaDesc: Curry County; Eastern San Miguel County; Quay County
